name: Sundarbans Mangrove Forest
culture: Traditional honey collectors, tiger trackers, and boat communities
story: Home to the Royal Bengal Tiger and ancient fishing communities practicing centuries-old traditions that will vanish with the rising tides.

name: Glacier Village of Shimshal
culture: Last yak herders of the Himalayas, ancient trade route guardians
story: The highest settlement on the ancient Silk Road. Elders still speak a language with no written form, carrying stories that exist only in memory.

name: Isle de Jean Charles
culture: Biloxi-Chitimacha-Choctaw tribe, America's first climate refugees
story: 98% of the island has disappeared since 1955. The tribe that has lived here for generations is being forcibly relocated. Document their final days.

name: Tuvalu Islands
culture: Polynesian navigation traditions, traditional fishing ceremonies
story: An entire nation preparing to become the first country erased by climate change. Their government has already purchased land in Fiji for evacuation.

name: Ayoreo-Totobiegosode Territory
culture: One of the last uncontacted tribes in South America
story: Some members have never seen outsiders. Their forest home is being bulldozed for cattle. When they emerge, their 10,000-year-old way of life ends.

name: Venice Historic Center
culture: Gondoliers, glass blowers of Murano, original Venetian families
story: Only 50,000 original Venetians remain, down from 175,000 in 1950. The authentic Venice—not the tourist facade—is dying.

name: Dead Sea Shores
culture: Ancient salt harvesting traditions, therapeutic mud traditions
story: Losing 1 meter of depth per year. The shoreline has retreated 30km. Hotels built in the 1980s now stand 2km from the water.

name: Aral Sea Fishing Villages
culture: Ghost towns of former fishermen, ship graveyards in desert
story: Once the 4th largest lake on Earth, now 90% gone. Rusting ships sit 100km from water. Last fishermen share stories of abundance.
